comment.body:
@ulrichard: If you use [local Zeromail bot](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:67), you can keep deleted zeromail in your local.
For SMTP/POP3 check [ZeroMailProxy](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroMailProxy)
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Nope.
@Test20180221: it's from [Kanji damage](http://www.kanjidamage.com/) ;)
@leftside: thanks for the suggestion! Will try it. Canvas/nylon band is surely the lightest and most comfortable, thus a best choice :D

I'm not familiar with JavaScript, but guess it's a common issue and you can find quite some answers from search engine, iirc ZeroBlog injects `loaded` class to body after the page is full-loaded, thanks to that I can control when loading my css rules.

@Nofish: ok.. I figure out that in the hub I commented when my system ran out of space, the data.json became data-old.json, if I don't rename it back before I create a new comment, that hub will generate a new data.json and delete data-old.json, which leads to the lost of all data.
@A7oiz: sorry for the late reply, it's Boox Note, the hardware is nice, but software is pretty buggy.
@leftside: yep, for jogging I'm also just an amateur :P I would like to focus more on the tech part of 0net, but I don't know when I will do it, still need to put more time in other things T_T
@leftside: guess u watch too many videos/novels about hitman/assassin/terroism :p

@Ulrichard: a public multi-functional building. In local it's named 会所(meeting mall). From wiki title Kongsi:

> Kongsi were most commonly known as Chinese social organizations or partnerships, but the term was also used for various Chinese institutions. Amongst overseas Chinese, the word kongsi was applied to reference both clan organizations, whose members shared a common descent, and social clubs, for Chinese immigrants originating from the same province. After the 19th century, these organizations came to be known as hui guan or hwee kuan (會館, literally meaning "meeting hall").
@Ulrichard: sure, I have a driving license but still don't own a car, won't consider a petrol car anyway.
@Ansho Rei: thx!
@Astrr: FYI no English version available on Wikipedia yet

> WebAssembly is also not meant to replace JavaScript. This is somewhat of a controversial opinion, as a large group of WebAssembly devotees online are convinced that it represents the death knell of JavaScript. While it might signal the beginning of a new era in which you will write significantly less manual JavaScript, you still need JS to host WebAssembly 1.0 in the browser.

@Ansho Rei: yup, but JS has a huge market and lots of supporters, and who know how they might do to leverage or monetize wasm in their favor. Another related topic is about Typescript afaik it's promoted by Microsoft
@Freeperson: idk, you may need to ask the project creators/maintainers directly

@caryoscelus: eh.. I copied that link from Tusky app, and some invisible character was after that link. Now it should work
@caryoscelus: thx for the info :D

post.body: Hallo ZeroMe!

Looks like there is a big bug with Blue hub, my profile was reset after deleting a comment, and can't create a post any more. Not only me, there are quite many profiles in Blue hub like this.. but who cares XP
--- ---
I figure out that some profiles of this kind were generated when a user from other hub commented on Bluehub.. so it's not an issue from Bluehub, and probably a deeper bug, like ZeroMe rewrote wrong stuff to a profile when there were some heavy loading process and glitch ..

> Yes, wife and also sons are running Arch. Everything in my home is Arch. As I mentioned.. I have a hard time using anything but Arch nowadays. ;)

["True Archer"](?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ/85) :O

"By looking at the radicals you can see how Politically Incorrect Ancient China was when they were inventing kanji. You see three women and you'd assume the kanji would mean something positive, like sisterhood or a cheerleader human pyramid. Buuuuuut no." XD
Local peer discovery works pretty well ^^
Enter immortal (山人) mode XP

One more shot for my previous post. It's long enough for reading when standing, too! Btw, the software (Android 6) of Boox Note is decent but buggy (Yotaphone 2 is alot better, Yotaphone 3 is still a joke), official reading app has stats feature and sends my reading activities to someone's server, for me that's unacceptable. A router firewall should be enough to cut (and analyze) all traffic. But I will simply keep it offline until the root code and tutorial is out X)

DIY a band for Pebble time, from Casio SGW-100, default rubber band is not round and doesn't suit the wrist, a canvas band I bought becomes smelly after sport.. steel band is a bit too heavy, good leather band is expensive and probably not worth the money, anyway, they match each other quite well, and the band is 200M water resistant XP

Discovered [a classical mute-nerd fellow](?Profile/1GrEenUGRWnzaNZjR3XsQa6dQgdPDTyt7i/1GgXbWMo4NkVQNKbLJFvEephA9rPLp9j2P/grahf@zeroid.bit). How mute-nerdy s/he (on ZeroMe) is? 7 posts from Aug. 2016 to May. 2017, when someone replied him to his second post in Nov. 2017, s/he replied two days later..

ZeroMe is the social network I take part in the most in my life btw X) I don't fit instant group chatting, so I was pretty mute in IRC and seldom log in there in these days. I like the user-owned nature and mutable data type of ZeroMe and ZeroBlog, I'm pretty sure my English writing and communication skills have improved a lot since I kept refining my posts on ZeroNet. I'm probably a bit too self-conscious and thus not a good discussion participant, or sometimes my opinion is just like a full stop and no one else has any other things to reply.. for me such things happened a lot on ZeroTalk. Except that sometimes I can have a long discussion with someone, like [this one](?Post/1White24UrrwQrD86o6Vrc1apgZ1x1o51/13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE/1519602172), maybe it's also because most people come here for anti-censorship and politics but I prefer more about general knowledge, decentralization, freesoftware, privacy, diversity, etc. Anyway, I can't happily make friends here, [it's all Javascript's fault](?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1522618664) ! X(

-1 peer, happened when I deleted the image for saving banwidth. Don't know why, Iirc the minimum is 1 peer. Maybe @空澄砂夜 senpai has a theory for it
--- ---
Hmm, the minus 1 function called twice?

> the late Professor Joshua Whatmough, ..., used to complain in seminar groups, "Why do they have to use that damn word phoneme?" But soon afterwards he not only started to use the word himself,  but also insisted on the classically correct form of the adjective phonematic instead of the most commonly used form phonemic.

p861, Language and Symbolic Systems, Y.R. Chao

My home ZeroNet raspi server has one more terminal member now \o/ thanks to [NetGuard](https://f-droid.org/app/eu.faircode.netguard) app, I can happily turn on the wifi of my ereader and still able to control my data and privacy!
--- ---
Btw, I accidentally deleted this profile again X( I run this node by Linux Deploy, and the container image is 2 GB, and.. when it was out of space, my new post couldn't write into the `data.json` and something severely corrupted, I `rm` some files (I even couldn't run `pacman -Scc`..), and created a new post, then my previous posts and comments in this profile were all gone ;_; Luckily I keep doing backup by a script~

Another complaint worth €3.7 billion was filed with French data protection authority France CNIL in the case of Google’s Android operating system.

> Ever heard about "Dark Patterns"? Probably, as I tooted about it a couple of days ago: companies designing the interfaces of their products (websites, apps, etc.) to trick you to do what *they* want you to do. Here's another article on it. If you don't mind Youtube, follow up to the video which explains it by examples.
>
> https://lifehacker.com/how-to-notice-and-avoid-dark-patterns-online-1827734449
>
> \#darkpatterns

Noice: Ad-free indefinite background noises (Relax, improve focus, and boost productivity with minimal background noises) - https://f-droid.org/app/com.github.ashutoshgngwr.noice
> For a lot of people, a little background noise is helpful to calm down and focus. In some cases, it's also a boost to productivity. Background noise (ambience) can also help minimize the effects of stress.

Features
- 24 recorded noises
- Make customised mix
- Save your favorite mixes
- Auto sleep timer
- Play alongside other music players
- Individual volume control for each noise source
- Offline playback
- Light and dark app theme variants

Noise library
- Forest set (birds, bonfire, night, wind, palm trees, etc.)
- Monsoon set (rain, thunders)
- Teleportation set (coffee shop, office, moving train, in-flight, seaside, riverbank, etc.)
- Raw noise (white, pink, brownian)

Once upon a time, we looked into the sky to look for stars. Nowadays, we look at our phone to look for satellites 😑:

Look4Sat: Radio satellite tracker (Satellite tracker and passes predictor) - https://f-droid.org/app/com.rtbishop.look4sat

Main features:

* Calculating satellite passes for up to one week (168 hours)

* Calculating passes for the current or manually entered location

* Showing the list of currently active and upcoming satellite passes

* Showing the active pass progress, polar trajectory and transceivers info

* Showing the satellite positional data, footprint and ground track on a map

* Offline first: passes predictions are made offline. Weekly updates of TLEs and transceivers DB are recommended.

And a long-time maintained/-ing one:

GPSTest (An app for testing GPS and GNSS capabilities of a device) - https://f-droid.org/app/com.android.gpstest.osmdroid

> Almost 6 years old, and Fairphone are still pushing the Fairphone 2 by porting Android 9 to it [[src](https://pod.geraspora.de/posts/12112222)]

https://www.fairphone.com/en/2020/06/18/fairphone-2-gets-android-9

> But now we’re facing the same challenges all over again. If Android 7 isn’t maintained by Google anymore, Android 7 users will eventually be exposed to security and usability issues – leaky roofs, termites in the ceiling beams, and cracked basements. So it makes sense to try upgrading to a higher version of Android that is still actively maintained by Google.
> ## Blueprints
> Enter Android 9. After our learnings from Android 7, we knew that this time we wanted to build the house from the ground up, allowing full control all the way through.
